channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-1603] MR failed "RetriesExhaustedException: Trying to contact region server Some server for region TestTable..."
item.description:
Here is the master. Region TestTable,\x00\x00\x06\x05\x01\x05\x07\x09\x08\x00,1246462685358 was split at 16:11:42,865. My MR job failed at 18:12:26,462 with this:


2009-07-01 18:12:26,462 WARN org.apache.hadoop.mapred.TaskTracker: Error running child

org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.RetriesExhaustedException: Trying to contact region server Some server for region TestTable,�,1246464670313, row '��		', but failed after 10 attempts.

Exceptions:

...

Why after ten attempts did the client not find the region?


2009-07-01 16:11:42,865 [IPC Server handler 2 on 60001] INFO org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.ServerManager: Received MSG_REPORT_SPLIT: TestTable,\x00\x00\x06\x05\x01\x05\x07\x09\x08\x00,1246462685358: Daughters; TestTable,\x00\x00\x06\x05\x01\x05\x07\x09\x08\x00,1246464670313, TestTable,\x00\x01\x01\x04\x04\x07\x02\x08\x08\x03,1246464670313 from aa0-000-15.u.powerset.com,60020,1246461673026; 1 of 3

2009-07-01 16:11:42,866 [IPC Server handler 2 on 60001] INFO org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.RegionManager: Assigning region TestTable,\x00\x00\x06\x05\x01\x05\x07\x09\x08\x00,1246464670313 to aa0-000-15.u.powerset.com,60020,1246461673026

2009-07-01 16:11:45,905 [IPC Server handler 8 on 60001] INFO org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.ServerManager: Received MSG_REPORT_PROCESS_OPEN: TestTable,\x00\x01\x01\x04\x04\x07\x02\x08\x08\x03,1246464670313 from aa0-000-15.u.powerset.com,60020,1246461673026; 1 of 3

item.summary: MR failed "RetriesExhaustedException: Trying to contact region server Some server for region TestTable..."

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: This seems pretty easy to manufacture on our small test cluster. I even seen it local doing PE up into standalone cluster.
Added debugging to regionserver. I see WrongRegionException: "Requested row out of range for ..." doing batch Puts. Trying to figure if this issue in client cache of regions.

The .meta. table is all wonky:


2009-07-06 18:54:30,763 [RegionManager.metaScanner] INFO org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.BaseScanner: RegionManager.metaScanner scanning meta region {server: X.X.X.140:60020, regionname: .META.,,1, startKey: <>} 

2009-07-06 18:54:30,768 [RegionManager.rootScanner] DEBUG org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.BaseScanner: ROW hri=REGION => {NAME => '.META.,,1', STARTKEY => '', ENDKEY => '', ENCODED => 1028785192, TABLE => {{NAME => '.META.', IS_META => 'true', MEMSTORE_FLUSHSIZE => '16384', FAMILIES => [{NAME => 'historian', VERSIONS => '2147483647', COMPRESSION => 'NONE', TTL => '604800', BLOCKSIZE => '8192', IN_MEMORY => 'false', BLOCKCACHE => 'false'}, {NAME => 'info', VERSIONS => '10', COMPRESSION => 'NONE', TTL => '2147483647', BLOCKSIZE => '8192', IN_MEMORY => 'false', BLOCKCACHE => 'false'}]}}, serverName=X.X.X.140:60020, startCode=1246905530242

2009-07-06 18:54:30,794 [RegionManager.metaScanner] DEBUG org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.BaseScanner: ROW hri=REGION => {NAME => 'TestTable,\x00\x06\x05\x01\x05\x04\x07\x08\x05\x07,1246906206915', STARTKEY => '\x00\x06\x05\x01\x05\x04\x07\x08\x05\x07', ENDKEY => '', ENCODED => 373711036, TABLE => {{NAME => 'TestTable', FAMILIES => [{NAME => 'info', VERSIONS => '3', COMPRESSION => 'NONE', TTL => '2147483647', BLOCKSIZE => '65536', IN_MEMORY => 'false', BLOCKCACHE => 'true'}]}}, serverName=X.X.X.141:60020, startCode=1246905530271

End keys on one region do not match the start keys no next.
Great (in a way). This is a reproduction of the issue that Andrew Lee reported last month.

Looks like we are making incorrect splits:


2009-07-06 21:29:00,591 [regionserver/208.76.44.141:60020.compactor] INFO org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.CompactSplitThread: region split, META updated, and report to master all successful. Old region=REGION => {NAME => 'TestTable,\x00\x04\x05\x02\x01\x04\x09

\x09\x05\x03,1246915671694', STARTKEY => '\x00\x04\x05\x02\x01\x04\x09\x09\x05\x03', ENDKEY => '', ENCODED => 532846028, OFFLINE => true, SPLIT => true, TABLE => {{NAME => 'TestTable', FAMILIES => [{NAME => 'info', COMPRESSION => 'NONE', VERSIONS => '3', TTL => '21

47483647', BLOCKSIZE => '65536', IN_MEMORY => 'false', BLOCKCACHE => 'true'}]}}, new regions: TestTable,\x00\x04\x05\x02\x01\x04\x09\x09\x05\x03,1246915729181, TestTable,\x00\x03\x09\x02\x04\x09\x04\x08\x01\x04,1246915729181. Split took 11sec

It would seem we're making split with a key that is less than that of the parent region (if the binary output can be trusted);

TestTable,\x00\x03\x09\x02\x04\x09\x04\x08\x01\x04,1246915729181 is <
TestTable,\x00\x04\x05\x02\x01\x04\x09\x09\x05\x03,1246915671694

@Andrew – I'm looking for Andrew Lee issue...

So, the above wonky table and split keys outside of Region range was because of HBASE-1615.

Let me see if still have original complaint still exists now 1615 has been applied.
Debugs and better reporting of binary in exceptions. Helpful debugging this issue so far.
I committed this debugging patch. Will help if we see this issue again. Also had fix up for when exceptions throw with messages that have binary data in it and some small javadoc fixes.
Moving out of 0.20.0. Root cause seems to have been fixed by 1615. Meantime have better debugging in case this arises again.

I am getting what looks like a reappearance of this issue. I am trying to insert approximately 70 million pieces into an HBase instance (trunk version 808546 checked out in late August, so I assume it contains the fix from 1615). My mappers fail on flushCommit with the following:

Mikhail: I doubt very much its you. Its a pity you don't have a timestamp for when you saw the RetriesExhaustedException issue. It seems like you are having the issue originally described here and another, the missing .META. region.

I just saw this issue again myself with RC3.

First, the client-side up in the MR task. The task fails because of TestTable,0254895141,1251965526935. It says retries exhausted but it doesn't look like it was trying very had... we timed out too fast it would seem.
